description: Erection of mansard roof extension to main rear roof and above part of two-storey back addition; formation of roof terrace above two-storey back addition with 1.7m high screen surround; and installation of 2 x rooflights to the front slope and 1 x rooflight to the side roof slope of the front gable.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings (2014/154 Sheet 2, 2014/154 Sheet 3, 2014/154 Sheet 4, 2014/154 Sheet 5, 2014/154 Sheet 6 and 2014/154 Sheet 7) and specifications, unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 3 - The external materials to be used in the approved development shall match those of the existing building.
In the interest of the appearance of the development, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 and DMS2.
Condition : 4 - The rooflights hereby approved, shall be of a conservation area specification i.e. in-line and flush within the roof pitch that they would be located.
In the interests of preserving the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with Council policies DMS1 and DMS2.
Condition : 5 - The screening to the roof terrace, shown on the approved drawing, shall be obscure glazed and completed before any use of the terrace commences, and retained permanently afterwards.
To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking in accordance with Council policy DMS1(c).
Condition : 6 - The side facing window in the extension above the back addition shall be glazed with obscured glass and fixed shut up to 1.7m above floor level and maintained as such in the future, unless approved otherwise by the local planning authority in writing.
To control overlooking, and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy DMS1(c).
Condition : 7 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
